channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OK
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OK

item.title: Report E-2024050271
item.description:
Report E-2024050271

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-16T15:11:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-01
  • City: OKLAHOMA CITY
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that 2 gallons of SOFT TOUCH CLEAR was released from two damaged 5-gallon metal drums due to improper blocking. The release impacted the trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller, and they felt comfortable that terminal personnel could clean the release with the personal protective equipment available on-site.

item.title: Report E-2024050194
item.description:
Report E-2024050194

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-13T15:12:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-08
  • City: GLENPOOL
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LTU experienced a NA1993 Glycol Ether EB release from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1 cup of product released to a 4’ x 4’ area of the trailer floor due to improper loading. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all impacted absorbents into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024050169
item.description:
Report E-2024050169

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-13T15:12:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-26
  • City: OKLAHOMA CITY
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 26, 2024, one (1) 275-gallon tote of UN3265 was damaged by improper stacking and released approximately four (4) ounces of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH personnel deployed neutralizers to the dock floor and exterior of the tote and utilized hand tools and absorbent pads to remediate the impacted surfaces. LSH patched the one (1) 275-gallon tote, placed absorbent pads beneath the tote and wrapped the tote in a poly sheet. Crews appropriately labeled and staged the poly sheet wrapped 275-gallon tote onsite. All spent absorbent pads and generated waste were collected and containerized into one (1) 5-gallon plastic pail for disposal.
